name: Blocking Artifact Grid Analysis
description: Analyzes JPEG block boundary artifacts to detect inconsistent compression grids indicating tampering.
algorithm: Block Artifact Grid (BAG) Extraction and Consistency Analysis
mechanism: JPEG compression creates an 8×8 block grid. When a region is spliced from a differently compressed source, the block grid alignment becomes inconsistent.
parameters: Block size: 8×8, Grid detection: cross-boundary gradient, Alignment: phase analysis, Map: block visibility
source: Fan, Z. & de Queiroz, R. (2003) — Identification of Bitmap Compression History, IEEE TIP
useCase: Detecting spliced regions by finding JPEG compression grid inconsistencies

references.title: Fan, Z. & de Queiroz, R. (2003) — Identification of Bitmap Compression History, IEEE TIP

strengths:
• Directly linked to JPEG compression
• Can localize tampered regions
• Well-understood theoretical basis
• Effective on single-compressed images
limitations:
• Only works on JPEG images
• Double compression can mask artifacts
• Requires sufficient image quality
• May miss small tampered regions
